name: nuxi
desc: A Nuxt CLI (nicknamed Nuxi) provides a no dependency experience for easily scaffolding your Nuxt projects.

usages.name: init
usages.desc: The init command initializes a fresh Nuxt project using unjs/giget.

--template.name: Template
--template.desc: Specify template name or git repository to use as a template. Format is gh:org/name to use a custom github template.

--force.name: Force clone to any existing directory.

--offline.name: Do not attempt to download from github and only use local cache.

--prefer-offline.name: Try local cache first to download templates.

usages.name: Add
usages.desc: Quick add components, pages, and plugins to your Nuxt project.

--cwd.name: The directory of the target application.

--force.name: Force override file if it already exists.

--https.name: Listen with https protocol with a self-signed certificate by default

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

--dotenv.name: Environment file
--dotenv.desc: Point to another .env file to load, relative to the root directory.

--no-clear.name: Does not clear the console after startup

--ssl-key.name: Specify the key for the https certificate

usages.name: Build
usages.desc: The build command creates a .output directory with all your application, server and dependencies ready for production.

--dotenv.name: Environment file
--dotenv.desc: Point to another .env file to load, relative to the root directory.

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

usages.name: generate
usages.desc: The generate command pre-renders every route of your application and stores the result in plain HTML files that you can deploy on any static hosting services. The command triggers the nuxi build command with the prerender argument set to true

--dotenv.name: Environment file
--dotenv.desc: Point to another .env file to load, relative to the root directory.

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

usages.name: Analyze
usages.desc: The analyze command builds Nuxt and analyzes the production bundle (experimental).

usages.name: preview
usages.desc: The preview command starts a server to preview your Nuxt application after running the build command. The start command is an alias for preview.

--dotenv.name: Environment file
--dotenv.desc: Point to another .env file to load, relative to the root directory.

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

usages.name: prepare
usages.desc: The prepare command creates a .nuxt directory in your application and generates types. This can be useful in a CI environment or as a postinstall command in your package.json.

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

usages.name: typecheck
usages.desc: The typecheck command runs vue-tsc to check types throughout your app.

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

usages.name: upgrade
usages.desc: The upgrade command upgrades Nuxt 3 to the latest version.

-f.name: Removes node_modules and lock files before upgrade.

usages.name: Cleanup
usages.desc: The cleanup command removes common generated Nuxt files and caches.

form.name: Root directory
form.desc: The root directory of the application to bundle.

usages.name: info
usages.desc: The info command logs information about the current or specified Nuxt project.

content:
Example

  • # Generates `components/TheHeader.vue`
npx nuxi add component TheHeader

  • # Generates `composables/foo.ts`
npx nuxi add composable foo
